newsitem.title: PERU: Strong tremor shakes southern Peru.
newsitem.headline: Strong tremor shakes southern Peru.

text.p: A strong earthquake shook southern Peru and northern Chile on Tuesday, causing landslides and startling residents, but no injuries were immediately reported, civil defence officials and radio reports said.
"The quake was approximately six on the Richter scale," said Valentin Quinones, a civil defence official in the southern city of Tacna, some 840 miles (1,350 kms) south of Lima.
He said there were three aftershocks but the city suffered no major damage.
Local radio said the tremor rocked the southern Peruvian department of Tacna at about 2:00 p.m. local time (1900 GMT), causing landslides. Residents also dashed out of their homes.
Radio dispatches said there were no immediate reports of injuries in the region.
The area is near two mines owned by U.S.-based Southern Peru Copper Corp., Peru's largest copper producer, where floods caused by heavy seasonal rains interrupted production early this year.
